neur_slice(neuron_type: src.NeuronTypes.NeuronTypes, nr_ex: int, nr_in: int) → slice

By design, we put excitatory neurons in lists before inhibitory. This function returns relevant slices.

By design, we put excitatory neurons in lists before inhibitory. Returns the type of the neuron at a particular ID.

misc.plot_binary_heatmap(im: numpy.ndarray[int, int, float], path: str) → None#

Plots a heatmap with the binary color scheme

Parameters

  • im (numpy.ndarray[(int, int), float]) – matrix to plot

  • path (str) – path for saving the resulting plot

Return type

None

misc.neur_slice(neuron_type: src.NeuronTypes.NeuronTypes, nr_ex: int, nr_in: int) → slice#

By design, we put excitatory neurons in lists before inhibitory. This function returns relevant slices.

Parameters

  • neuron_type (NeuronTypes) – the type of neuron we need indices for.

  • nr_ex (int) – number of excitatory neurons.

  • nr_in (int) – number of inhibitory neurons.

Returns

a slice for the neurons of given type.

Return type

slice

misc.neur_type(id: int, nr_ex: int) → src.NeuronTypes.NeuronTypes#

By design, we put excitatory neurons in lists before inhibitory. Returns the type of the neuron at a particular ID.

Parameters

  • id (int) – the ID of the neuron.

  • nr_ex (int) – number of excitatory neurons in a network, where the neuron is located.

Returns

the neuron type.

Return type

NeuronTypes

misc.multiply_point(point: tuple[float, Ellipsis], coef: float) → tuple[float, Ellipsis]#

Multiples each value in a given tuple by a coefficient.

Parameters

  • point (tuple[float, ...]) – the point to multiply.

  • coef (float) – the coefficient to multiply the points by.

Returns

the tuple, where each element is multiplied by the coefficient.

Return type

tuple[float]

misc.add_points(points: list[tuple[float, Ellipsis]], coefs=None) → tuple[float, Ellipsis]#

Adds values in tuples (for adding coordinates).

Parameters

  • points (list[tuple[float, ...]]) – list of tuples to add together.

  • coefs (list[float]) – coefficients before the tuples (all 1’s by default).

Raises

AssertionError: if the number of tuples and coefficients are not equal.

Raises

AssertionError: if the number of values is not equal in all tuples.

Returns

the sum of tuples.

Return type

tuple[float, …]

misc.point_ceil(p: tuple[float, Ellipsis]) → tuple[int, Ellipsis]#

Computes the ceiling of a tuple.

Parameters

p (tuple[float, ...]) – a tuple.

Returns

tuple of ceilings of all values in the given tuple.

Return type

tuple[int, …]

misc.euclidian_dist(p1: tuple[float, float], p2=(0, 0)) → float#

Calculates the Euclidian distance between two points.

Parameters

  • p1 (tuple[float, float]) – coordinates of point_pix 1.

  • p2 (tuple[float, float]) – coordinates of point_pix 2.

Returns

the Euclidean distance between two 2D points.

Return type

float
